description.p: Inspired by the quality and variety of XML tooling available for the Java platform (StAX, JAXB, etc.), Jackson is a multi-purpose Java library for processing JSON data format. Jackson aims to be the best possible combination of fast, correct, lightweight, and ergonomic for developers.

conf.name: annotations
conf.description: Core annotations used for value types, used by Jackson data binding package.

conf.name: core
conf.description: Core Jackson abstractions, basic JSON streaming API implementation

conf.name: databind
conf.description: General data-binding functionality for Jackson: works on core streaming API.

conf.name: dataformat-avro
conf.description: Support for reading and writing AVRO-encoded data via Jackson abstractions.

conf.name: dataformat-cbor
conf.description: Support for reading and writing Concise Binary Object Representation ([CBOR](https://www.rfc-editor.org/info/rfc7049) encoded data using Jackson abstractions (streaming API, data binding, tree model)

conf.name: dataformat-csv
conf.description: Support for reading and writing CSV-encoded data via Jackson abstractions.

conf.name: dataformat-smile
conf.description: Support for reading and writing Smile ('binary JSON') encoded data using Jackson abstractions (streaming API, data binding, tree model)

conf.name: dataformat-xml
conf.description: Data format extension for Jackson (http://jackson.codehaus.org) to offer alternative support for serializing POJOs as XML and deserializing XML as pojos. Support implemented on top of Stax API (javax.xml.stream), by implementing core Jackson Streaming API types like JsonGenerator, JsonParser and JsonFactory. Some data-binding types overridden as well (ObjectMapper sub-classed as XmlMapper).

conf.name: dataformat-yaml
conf.description: Support for reading and writing YAML-encoded data via Jackson abstractions.

conf.name: datatype-guava
conf.description: Add-on datatype-support module for Jackson (http://jackson.codehaus.org) that handles Guava (http://code.google.com/p/guava-libraries/) types (currently mostly just collection ones)

conf.name: datatype-hibernate3
conf.description: Add-on module for Jackson (http://jackson.codehaus.org) to support Hibernate (http://hibernate.org) version 3.x data types.

conf.name: datatype-hibernate4
conf.description: Add-on module for Jackson (http://jackson.codehaus.org) to support Hibernate (http://hibernate.org) version 4.x data types.

conf.name: datatype-hppc
conf.description: Add-on module for Jackson (http://jackson.codehaus.org) to support High-Performance Primitive Collections (HPPC, see http://labs.carrotsearch.com/hppc.html) data types.

conf.name: datatype-jdk7
conf.description: Add-on module for Jackson (http://jackson.codehaus.org) to support JDK 7 data types.

conf.name: datatype-jdk8
conf.description: Add-on module for Jackson (http://jackson.codehaus.org) to support JDK 8 data types.

conf.name: datatype-joda
conf.description: Add-on module for Jackson (http://jackson.codehaus.org) to support Joda (http://joda-time.sourceforge.net/) data types.

conf.name: datatype-json-org
conf.description: Support for datatypes of 'org.json' JSON library (see http://json.org/java), mainly to make it easier to upgrade code to Jackson, using automated conversions.

conf.name: datatype-jsr310
conf.description: Add-on module to support JSR-310 (Java 8 Date & Time API) data types.

conf.name: datatype-jsr353
conf.description: Add-on module for Jackson (http://jackson.codehaus.org) to support working with JSR-353 (JDK Json-processing API) node typesm via data-binding

conf.name: default
conf.description: Most common configuration of core, databind, and annotations.

conf.name: jaxrs-base
conf.description: Pile of code that is shared by all Jackson-based JAX-RS providers.

conf.name: jaxrs-cbor-provider
conf.description: Functionality to handle CBOR encoded input/output for JAX-RS implementations (like Jersey and RESTeasy) using standard Jackson data binding.

conf.name: jaxrs-json-provider
conf.description: Functionality to handle JSON input/output for JAX-RS implementations (like Jersey and RESTeasy) using standard Jackson data binding.

conf.name: jaxrs-smile-provider
conf.description: Functionality to handle Smile (binary JSON) input/output for JAX-RS implementations (like Jersey and RESTeasy) using standard Jackson data binding.

conf.name: jaxrs-xml-provider
conf.description: Functionality to handle XML input/output for JAX-RS implementations (like Jersey and RESTeasy) using standard Jackson data binding.

conf.name: jr-all
conf.description: "Uber" jar that contains all Jackson jr components as well as underlying Jackson core Streaming, in a single jar.

conf.name: jr-objects
conf.description: Simple data-binding that builds directly on 'jackson-core' (streaming), has no other dependencies, and provides additional builder-style content generator

conf.name: module-afterburner
conf.description: Jackson (https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) extension module used to enhance access functionality using bytecode generation.

conf.name: module-guice
conf.description: Stuff to make integration with Guice a bit easier

conf.name: module-jaxb-annotations
conf.description: Support for using JAXB annotations as an alternative to 'native' Jackson annotations, for configuring data binding.

conf.name: module-jsonSchema
conf.description: Add-on module for Jackson (http://jackson.codehaus.org) to support JSON Schema (http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-zyp-json-schema-03) version 3 generation.

conf.name: module-kotlin
conf.description: Add-on module for Jackson (http://jackson.codehaus.org) to support Kotlin language, specifically introspection of method/constructor parameter names, without having to add explicit property name annotation.

conf.name: module-mrbean
conf.description: Functionality for implementing interfaces and abstract types dynamically ('bean materialization'), integrated with Jackson (although usable externally as well)

conf.name: module-parameter-names
conf.description: Add-on module for Jackson (http://jackson.codehaus.org) to support introspection of method/constructor parameter names, without having to add explicit property name annotation.

conf.name: module-paranamer
conf.description: AnnotationIntrospectors that use Paranamer (http://paranamer.codehaus.org) to introspect names of constructor (and factory method) parameters.

conf.name: module-scala_2.10
conf.description: jackson-module-scala 2.10.x

conf.name: module-scala_2.11
conf.description: jackson-module-scala 2.11.x
